snippet: The fall of Ramadi to the Islamic State, despite intensified American airstrikes in recent weeks in a bid to save the city, represented the biggest victory this year for the extremist group.
abstract: Iraqi city of Ramadi falls to Islamic State militants, marking their most significant victory so far in 2015; militants ransack military headquarters, seize large store of weapons and kill those loyal to government; offensive has claimed lives of at least 500 and comes despite intensified American airstrikes.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Omar al-Jawoshy and Falih Hassan from Baghdad; an employee of The New York Times from Anbar Province; and Eric Schmitt and Helene Cooper from Washington.

lead_paragraph: The fall of Ramadi to the Islamic State, despite intensified American airstrikes in recent weeks in a bid to save the city, represented the biggest victory this year for the extremist group.

headline.main: Key Iraqi City Falls to ISIS as Last of Security Forces Flee
headline.print_headline: ISIS Captures Key Iraqi City Despite Strikes

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
